thread.title: Water relief for Gauteng as restrictions to be eased
thread.title_full: Water relief for Gauteng as restrictions to be eased

title: Water relief for Gauteng as restrictions to be eased
text:
Print 
The Vaal Dam was almost 100% full‚ said Department of Water Affairs spokesman Sputnik Ratau. 
"This morning the Vaal dam was at 97.89% and more sluice gates have been opened. They will remain open for at least the next two days" he said. 2 gates are now open #VaalDam pic.twitter.com/yFXkprZPld — Water Sanitation SA (@DWS_RSA) February 26, 2017 
Ratau said the lifting of the water restrictons would be gazetted on Monday with immediate effect. 
"This will outline what restrictions in Gauteng are being lifted." 
Sluice gates have been open since Friday at Bloemhof Dam in the North West. 
However‚ "we are still in a drought"‚ said Ratau. 
But good rains had had a positive effect on the Vaal integrated river system that fed mainly Gauteng‚ parts of North West and small parts of Mpumalanga and the Free State.
